oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bobby Bare interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Bobby Bare (performer), conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:03) Bobby Bare talks about going to Cincinnati early in his career in search of a record label to sign him -- (00:20) Bare talks about meeting Chuck Sikes, but Bare was unable to sing as high as Sikes wanted him to -- (00:55) Bare talks about considering moving to Nashville, where all his country star heroes were -- (01:25) Bare talks about writing songs, and recording at King records -- (01:55) Bare talks about playing bass -- (02:10) Bare talks about a friend named Big Al, and jokes about the only way they were able to get rid of him was by getting two girls to take him to a club that cost money to get into -- (05:00) talks about Big Al introducing Bare to Speedy West, who gave him a record deal -- (05:20) talks about his current various record deals
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bare, Bobby, 1935-; Collie, Biff;
